extendedIngredients.name: iceberg lettuce
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 cups torn romaine or iceberg lettuce

extendedIngredients.name: mandarin orange segments
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup tangerine or mandarin orange segments

extendedIngredients.name: skinless boneless chicken breasts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces

extendedIngredients.name: non-alcoholic pina colada mix
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup thawed non-alcoholic pina colada mix, divided

recipes.title: Caribbean Chicken Caesar Salad for Two

winePairing.pairingText: Gavi, Albarino, and Pinot Grigio are my top picks for Chicken Caesar Salad. We recommend a crisp, dry white wine such as a Gavi, Albariño, or Pinot Grigio. These wines stand up to the pungent dressing and complement the other flavors. You could try Salneval Albarino. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 9 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Salneval Albarino
productMatches.description: Light straw in color, the nose of this Albariño is seductive with honey, pear and tropical fruit and a slight mineral component. It is racy andzesty with citrus and floral flavors in the mouth, yet is round and soft at the same time.It matches perfectly with fresh seafood and shellfish; is an ideal accompaniment to salty, spicy Asian cuisine; and is also great on its own as a cocktail wine. Truly adventurous food lovers will amaze and inspire their friends by serving it with the unlikely, but fantastic pairing of traditional barbequed ribs with a sweet, slightly spicy tomato based sauce.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                Combine chicken and 2 tablespoons pina colada mix. In a large skillet coated with cooking spray, cook and stir chicken mixture over medium heat until chicken is no longer pink. Remove from the heat; set aside.                                                                                           Combine the tangerines, celery, pineapple, onion and olives in a large bowl. In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice, mayonnaise, cheese, garlic, salt, pepper and the remaining pina colada mix.                                                                                           Add chicken and romaine to the tangerine mixture; drizzle with dressing and toss to coat. Serve immediately.                                        Yield: 2 servings.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Caribbean Chicken Caesar Salad for Two in  Taste of Home                                                                                                                                                                                                Nutritional Facts                                                                             2 cups equals 300 calories, 9 g fat (3 g saturated fat), 65 mg cholesterol, 311 mg sodium, 30 g carbohydrate, 3 g fiber, 25 g protein. Diabetic Exchanges: 1-1/2 starch, 1 fat, 1/2 fruit.                                                                                                                                                                    Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: Combine chicken and 2 tablespoons pina colada mix. In a large skillet coated with cooking spray, cook and stir chicken mixture over medium heat until chicken is no longer pink.
Remove from the heat; set aside.
Combine the tangerines, celery, pineapple, onion and olives in a large bowl. In a small bowl, combine the lemon juice, mayonnaise, cheese, garlic, salt, pepper and the remaining pina colada mix.
Add chicken and romaine to the tangerine mixture; drizzle with dressing and toss to coat.
